input_text:
Job Title: ETL Business Intelligence (BI) Developer

Location: Mechanicsburg, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Prelude Services is a Managed Service Provider that has delivered innovative and secure IT services for over 25 years. Prelude's corporate office is located in Mechanicsburg, PA, while this position is fully remote/WFH. Prelude offers the following IT services: Outsourcing Cloud Computing 24x7 Service Desk Network Management Hardware and Software Support HIPAA IT Risk Assessment and Security Management Services Enterprise Reporting and Dashboards Looking foran exciting opportunity with a dynamic and fast-growing business? Great, we are looking for a well-rounded, experienced BI Developer like YOU! Preludeis a busy, dynamic, high-volume but friendly environment that will suit an organized person with a great eye for detail and plenty of team spirit.We hire team players who are interested in advancing their careers and are motivated to do their best to support our clients. As a Business Intelligence Developer / BI Developer , reporting to the Director of Software Development, you will work with a team to implement and maintain BI solutions, perform testing tasks, be involved with the design, and maintain documentation. You must be able to work independently with minimal supervision and may be engaged in multiple projects. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work as an integral part of a highly productive team of seasoned technical professionals. Position expectations: Designs specifications and standards for semantic layers and multi-dimensional models for complex business intelligence projects based on user requirements. Contributes to project proposal preparation and estimation and then participates in the completion of the development. Cultivate long-term strategic goals for BI development in conjunction with end users, managers, clients, and other stakeholders. Take a primary role in the development, implementation, and maintenance of complex business intelligence solutions. Lead the integration efforts for merging BI platforms with enterprise systems and applications. Test and document all new or modified BI systems, applications, and programs. Assist in the design of databases and data warehouses to ensure interoperability with BI solutions. Follow ETL design guidelines to ensure a manageable ETL infrastructure for the BI system. Provides technical support to end users and peers. You will need: Project experience of four years or more in BIdevelopment (data integration, data analysis, report writing, and dashboard creation). Experienced with Microsoft SQL database languages and technologies. Specifically T-SQL, SSAS, Tabular modeling, SSIS, SSRS, DAX, MDX. Experienced with maintaining a Power BI environment. Experienced with Microsoft SQL Server database and data warehouse design. Experienced in developing reports and visualizations with SQL Server Reporting Services report builder, Power BI builder apps, and Power BI service. Deep understanding of Power BI Pipeline, data analysis techniques, writing and debugging SQL queries, and working with various relational databases and disparate data sources. Experiencedwith SSIS or other ETL integration technologies. Familiar with Azure database, BI, and integration technologies. Familiar with the full development life cycle and Agile/SCRUM methodologies. Familiar with programming concepts, best practices, and change control procedures. Our Benefits: Our fast-paced and supportive environment will offer you lots of benefits â€“ a competitive salary, and opportunities for training and development. Being ranked as a "Best Place to Work in PA" (2017, 2020, 2022, 2023) we offer a wide range of benefits to our employees. Medical (and HSA with match), dental, vision, 401k (with match), Company paid LTD, STD and Life, which you are eligible for the first of the month after your date of employment. With our medical plan you have access to a confidential benefit that offers nurse navigation, disease management & prevention, nutrition education, and much more. Other great perks Prelude offers include casual dress, 6 paid holidays, Unsick Day, a $400 technology stipend (one time upon hire), we provide your laptop and dock, quarterly company meetings, access to a robust Employee Assistance Program, two PTO Cash Out days annually, and you can accrue 20 days of PTO your first year! Our culture is guided by our core values: respect for others, personal responsibility, sound judgment, innovativeness, and open and honest communication. Prelude is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. What to Expect: Following review of your application, you may be selected for a 10-15 minute phone screen with HR. Powered by JazzHR

Experience Level (if available): None
